columns.text: In this exercise, we are to determine the amount of external financing necessary for the financial plan.

## Financial Planning
\
Financial planning is referred to as the systematic method of the attainment of the company's financial goals. It indicates the actions and decisions to be done in the future for the company.

## Pro Forma Statements
\
Pro Forma statements include a forecasted balance sheet, an income statement, and a statement of cash flows. These financial statements are necessary for the determination of the summary of projected events in the succeeding years of operation of the firm.
\
The pro forma statements are considered outputs of the financial plan. The management would estimate the projected and would then produce the pro forma statements.

Now, let us determine the external financing needed using the following given:
 

<center>

|Given||
|:--|--:|
|Income Statement||
|$\hspace{20pt}$Sales|\$7,200|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Cost|\$4,730|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Net Income|\$2,470|
|Balance Sheet||
|$\hspace{20pt}$Assets|\$21,700|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Debt|\$9,100|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Equity|\$12,600|

Now, let us prepare the pro forma income statement:
 
$$\textbf{Pro Forma}\\
\textbf{Income Statement}$$

$$\begin{array}{l r}
\text{Sales}&{\$\hspace{23pt}8,424}\\
\text{Cost}&\underline{5,559.84}\\
\hspace{20pt}\textbf{Net Income}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$}\hspace{6pt}\textbf{2,864.16}}}\\
\end{array}$$

The total assets and the total debt and equity does not balance out based on the preceding computations. There are no cash dividends declared, therefore, the company should provide additional equity in the retained earnings.

Now, let us prepare the pro forma balance sheet:
 
$$\textbf{Pro Forma}\\
\textbf{Balance Sheet}$$

$$\begin{array}{l r l r}
\text{Assets}&{\$25,356.24}&\text{Debt}&{\$9,100.00}\\
{}&{}&\text{Equity}&\underline{15,464.16}\\
\hspace{20pt}\textbf{Total }&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$}\hspace{6pt}\textbf{25,356.24}}}&\hspace{20pt}\textbf{Total }&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$}\hspace{6pt}\textbf{24,564.16}}}\\
\end{array}$$
The problem will require us to compute the EFN (external financing needed) for Kerch Inc.

### Let's first provide the given data in the problem.

* Assets and costs are proportional to sales.
* Debt and equity are not proportionate to sales.
* No dividends are paid.
* Sales for next year are projected to be $8,424.00.

## Requirement 1.

### Compute the EFN of Kerch Inc.

### Calculate the projected equity section.

The projected equity is calculated by adding the retained earnings (net income less declared dividends) to the equity balance. The problem has no payout ratio nor declared dividends. Therefore the total amount of net income is considered as retained earnings.

 
The calculation is as follows.

$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\textbf{Accounts}&\underline{\textbf{Amount}}\\[5pt]
\text{Equity}&\$12,600.00\\
\text{Retained Earnings}&\underline{2,890.27}\\
\textbf{Projected Equity}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$15,490.27}}}


\end{array}
$$



Therefore, the projected equity is **$15,490.27**.

### Compute the EFN (external financing needed).

Assets should be equal to the liabilities and the equity section. The difference is attributable to the EFN.

$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\textbf{Accounts}&\underline{\textbf{Amount}}\\[5pt]
\text{Projected Assets}&\$25,389.00\\
\textbf{Less:}\\
\hspace{5pt}\text{Liabilities}&(9,100.00)\\
\hspace{5pt}\text{Equity}&\underline{(15,490.27)}\\
\textbf{EFN}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$798.73}}}


\end{array}
$$

Therefore, the EFN is **$798.73**.

textbook.authors: Bradford D. Jordan, Randolph W. Westerfield, Stephen A. Ross
textbook.title: Fundamentals of Corporate Finance
